page.title: 08Some Village Activities.
page.content: Eighty years ago the children of Tetsworth used to play cricket, run, dance and go to Scouts.Every September there was the Tetsworth Feast when a fair came to the Village Green, but this has dwindled away to nothing. For the older people there was the Tetsworth Brass Band and the Cricket Club. Today the children have to be taken by car into Thame for Brownie and Cub meetings. Within the village there are clubs run by the church and a Youth Club for 11-18 year olds has just started to meet twice a week. The Cricket Club still plays and is in the Premier League although there a only a few villagers in the team. Aunt Sally is played at the Swann Inn. There are colt football and cricket teams for the boys. A senior football team also plays regularly. For the ladies there is a thriving W.I.
